title.definition: A name given to the resource.
title.comment: The name by which the resource is formally known.

creator.definition: An entity primarily responsible for making the resource.
creator.comment: Examples include a person, an organization, or a service.

subject.definition: The topic of the resource, represented using keywords.
subject.comment: Typically expressed as key phrases or classification codes.

description.comment: May include an abstract, table of contents, or graphical representation.

publisher.definition: An entity responsible for making the resource available.
publisher.comment: Examples include a person, an organization, or a service.

contributor.definition: An entity that contributed to the creation of the resource.
contributor.comment: Examples include co-authors, editors, or funders.

date.definition: A point or period of time associated with an event in the resource's lifecycle.
date.comment: Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme like W3CDTF.

type.definition: The nature or genre of the resource.
type.comment: Use controlled vocabularies such as DCMI Type Vocabulary. The terms in the DCMI Type Vocabulary are: Collection, Dataset, Event, Image, InteractiveResource, MovingImage, PhysicalObject, Service, Software, Sound, StillImage, Text

format.definition: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource.
format.comment: Use standard MIME types to describe file format.

identifier.definition: A unique reference to the resource within a given context.
identifier.comment: Could be a DOI, ISBN, URL, or another formal identifier.

source.definition: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.
source.comment: Identify the source using a formal identification system.

language.comment: Use controlled vocabularies such as ISO 639-1 codes. For example 'en' for English, 'es' for Spanish.

relation.comment: May include references, citations, or derived works.

coverage.definition: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource.
coverage.comment: May include a geographic location, period, or event.

rights.definition: Information about rights held in and over the resource.
rights.comment: Includes copyright, licensing, and access conditions.
